page.title: 08SUE RYDER HOME, WHITWELL
page.content: There has been a house on the site of Stagenhoe Park since Domesday times. The present house is an 18th century building with some additions and in recent times has served as a maternity hospital and a prep school for boys. In 1969 Lady Ryder bought the house and 9 acres of land as a holiday home for Polish ex-prisoners of war but it is now a nursing home for severely disabled people.There are 40 patients_ suffering from Parkinson's Disease, Multiple Sclerosis,stroke victims and 14 people have Huntingdon's Chorea. Stagenhoe is the only home to accept sufferers from Huntingdon's Chorea and an extension is planned for this year to house 15 more patients.The disease is hereditary and has no cure.In spite of the patients' severe disabilities Stagenhoe is a very happy place.
